The Story of the Elder Khomadāyaka
“In the city of Bandhumatī,
I was a merchant at that time;
By that I supported my wife,
And I sowed seeds of merit.
As I was going along the road,
To the great seer Vipassī;
I gave him a single piece of linen,
For the sake of skill, to the Teacher.
For ninety-one eons,
The single piece of linen I gave then;
I do not know of a bad destination,
This is the fruit of giving linen.
Seventeen times from now,
One who was a horse-dealer;
Endowed with the seven treasures,
A lord over the four continents.
The four analytical knowledges,
And the eight liberations as well;
The six super-knowledges were realized,
The Buddha’s instruction was done.”🔽Thus did the Elder Khomadāyaka recite these verses.
